title: The first conformant M1 GPU driver
dot:
digraph M1_GPU_Driver{rankdir=LR;node[shape=box, style=rounded, fontname="Helvetica", fontsize=12];subgraph cluster_1{label="The first conformant M1 GPU driver";style=dotted; node1[label="Conformant OpenGL ES 3.1 drivers for M1- and M2-family GPUs"];node2[label="Install Linux to use drivers"];node3[label="Upgrade system with
'dnf upgrade' (Fedora)
or 'pacman -Syu' (Arch)"];node4[label="Reverse-engineered, free
and open source drivers"];node5[label="Only conformant OpenGL ES 3.1
implementation for M1/M2"];node6[label="Passed tens of thousands of tests"];node7[label="Recognized by the industry"];node8[label="Implementation must pass
the official conformance test suite"];node9[label="Test results submitted to Khronos"];node10[label="30-day review period"];node11[label="Listed on Khronos website"];node12[label="First conformant implementation
of any graphics standard for M1"];node13[label="Manufacturer's M1 drivers
not conformant for any standard"];node14[label="Commitment to quality
and open standards"];node15[label="OpenGL ES 3.1 adds compute shaders"];node16[label="Compute shaders accelerate
general computations"];node17[label="Atomic access to memory
solves race conditions"];node18[label="Atomic operations supported
by modern graphics hardware"];node19[label="M1 lacks hardware instructions
for image atomics"];node20[label="Calculate pixel address
for regular atomic operations"];node21[label="Interleave X- and Y-coordinates
for memory layout"];node22[label="Bit twiddling algorithm
for interleaving bits"];node23[label="M1 GPU assembly code
for interleaving"];node24[label="Reverse-engineering technique
for interleave instruction"];node25[label="Mystery instruction verified
by M1 GPU"];node26[label="One instruction replaces
vectorized assembly"];node1->node2;node2->node3;node3->node4;node4->node5;node5->node6;node6->node7;node7->node8;node8->node9;node9->node10;node10->node11;node11->node12;node12->node13;node13->node14;node14->node15;node15->node16;node16->node17;node17->node18;node18->node19;node19->node20;node20->node21;node21->node22;node22->node23;node23->node24;node24->node25;node25->node26;}}

title: Hackers can use credit bureaus to dox nearly anyone in America
dot: digraph{start[label="Enter target info (name, state) on Telegram"];search[label="Bot searches using target's credit header"];result[label="Receive file with personal info (addresses, relatives, phone, email, license info)"];cost[label="$15 in Bitcoin (or $20 for SSN)"];start->search;search->result;result->cost;criminal_start[label="Criminals tap into data supply chain"];criminal_method[label="Steal former law enforcement identities"];criminal_sell[label="Sell access to criminal cohorts"];criminal_targets[label="Used on high - profile targets"];criminal_start->criminal_method;criminal_method->criminal_sell;criminal_sell->criminal_targets;paid[label="Paid membership for unlimited access"];free[label="Free membership for limited access"];signin[label="Sign in for existing accounts"];{rank=same;paid;free;signin}}

title: Unlocking Discord Nitro features for free
